awd_abstract_narration:
This award is made as part of the FY 2019 Mathematical Sciences Postdoctoral Research Fellowships Program. Each of the fellowships supports a research and training project at a host institution in the mathematical sciences, including applications to other disciplines, under the mentorship of a sponsoring scientist. The title of the project for this fellowship to Daniel A. Bragg is "Geometry of Supersingular Varieties ". The host institution for the fellowship is University of California, Berkeley and the sponsoring scientist is Martin Olsson.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
I summarize my activity resulting from my support under NSF Postdoctoral Research Fellowship DMS-1902875 .

Research activity: I begin by summarizing the results of my research activity related to my three proposed projects. My first proposed project on the subject of supersingular twistor spaces has led to two papers, both currently still in progress. My second proposed project on the birational geometry of supersingular surfaces resulted in my publication ``Perfect points on genus one curves and consequences for supersingular K3 surfaces'' (with Max Lieblich). This paper corrected some errors in the literature, and shows that a certain class of strategies are insufficient to resolve Artin-Shioda's conjecture that supersingular K3 surfaces are unirational. My third proposed project on derived equivalences in positive characteristic resulted in several papers. In my publication ``Derived invariants from topological Hochschild homology'' (with Benjamin Antieau) I proved some new results concerning the derived invariance of certain quantities in positive characteristic, including Hodge numbers, Betti numbers, and Artin-Mazur heights. In my publication ``Hodge numbers are not derived invariants in positive characteristic'' (with Nicolas Addington) I found an example of pair of derived equivalent Calabi-Yau 3-folds in positive characteristic which have different Hodge numbers. In my publication ``Lifts of twisted {K}3 surfaces to characteristic 0'' I proved some new results on twisted K3 surfaces in positive and mixed characteristic. In particular, I proved that every twisted K3 surface in characteristic p lifts to characteristic 0, generalizing a result of Deligne, and constructed moduli spaces of twisted K3 surfaces over the integers. I applied this theory as well as techniques related to derived equivalences and Fourier-Mukai transforms in my publication ``Twisted derived equivalences and isogenies between K3 surfaces in positive characteristic'' (with Ziquan Yang) to prove some arithmetic results on K3 surfaces. Finally, while supported by this fellowship I produced two papers not directly related to my proposed projects. The first is my preprint ``Representability of cohomology of finite flat abelian group schemes'' (with Martin Olsson) and the second is my preprint ``Unipotent morphisms'' (with Jack Hall and Siddharth Mathur).

Broader impacts: While being supported by this postdoctoral research fellowship I co-organized several events at UC Berkeley aimed at encouraging undergraduates interested in math, including the 2020 Berkeley Undergraduate Number Theory Conference and the Undergraduate Brown Bag Lunches Series (with MUSA). I also co-organized the RTG seminar and supervised a reading course in algebraic topology for two advanced undergraduate students.


Last Modified: 10/31/2024
Modified by: Daniel A Bragg
